JECS 18 (2010) pp. 453-473, 10 figg. n./bl. et coul.

In December 2009, conservation of the paintings in the triconch funerary chapel discovered by the SCA in 2002 at the White Monastery revealed new details that connect this space with Shenoute. It is likely that his monastic community originally designed this tomb and its associated church to function not only as the burial place for the saint, but also as a shrine dedicated to his memory. - Avec résumé en anglais.
